messages.message: So SonarQube calculates code coverage without actually running the unit tests...?
That's a good question I'll check on that, but from what I have seen that's to be the case let me check and get back to you
That would be incredible if so. Calculating code coverage during static analysis is undecidable :slightly_smiling_face:
However, they may be using some heuristics (so: not 100% accurate)
Usually coverage is collected at runtime during unit test execution though

I went through the documentation (https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/10.8/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/python-test-coverage/) and found that we have to configure this for each project. It takes coverage reports as input for python for generating which is outside of sonarqube scanning. Once we procure a permanent license I'll come up with a plan to integrate this.
